results.title: Sunday father
results.creator_credit: International Productions, Films Incorporated, Sheldon Satin and Paul Leaf
results.brief_description: Shows the contemporary situation of a divorced man who takes his daughter on a once-a-week outing on Sunday afternoon. Focuses on the problem of a father trying to be friends with a little girl whom he sometimes feels barely knows him. Featuring Dustin Hoffman and Jane Schisgal with music and vocals by Janis Ian.

results.title: Sunday drives
results.creator_credit: ACMI, ACMI Digital Storytelling and Fiona Tinney
results.brief_description: Fiona Tinney delves into the jigsaw of the past, the stories she heard while going on Sunday drives with the family. Even though she was not very interested at the time, these stories, melded with the towns they drove through have imprinted on her memory as Tinney tries to hold on to them.

results.title: Sunday by the sea
results.creator_credit: Harlequin Productions, Leon Clore and Anthony Simmons
results.brief_description: Watching a typical day at the Brighton seaside, we see how the Londoner enjoys himself on one of his favourite excursions. Ballads made famous in music halls take the place of commentary. Photography by Walter Lassally. (Awards: Grand Prix, Venice)

results.title: Sunday bloody Sunday
results.creator_credit: Vectia Films, Joseph Janni and John Schlesinger
results.brief_description: Glenda Jackson, a career woman separated from her husband, and Peter Finch, a Jewish doctor, are caught in a love triangle with a young bisexual designer. Although the arrangement appears ideal, the trio must deal with the jealousy, fear and self doubt they encounter. This absorbing character study, originally shocking, is regarded as a forerunner of cinema’s increasingly mature treatment of homosexuality. Also stars Peggy Ashcroft.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Vectia Films, Joseph Janni and John Schlesinger

results.title: Sunday's dog
results.creator_credit: Pepper Horman, Maddie Jamieson Goddard and Fionnuala Keith
results.brief_description:
When Sunday went to live with her grandmother she didn’t have any friends to play with. One day a stray dog walked down the lane behind her house. It was missing a tail and an ear. Nobody wanted it. Sunday made friends with the dog but it was taken away to the pound. Weeks passed. Dogs were adopted and other dogs were led away to a big blue door. Finally, Sunday found the dog at the pound and adopted him. When they got home, Sunday made him a special hat with two ears and a tail for him to wag. Creators: Pepper Horman, Maddie Jamieson Goddard, Fionnuala Keith, Jennifer Petroploulos, Lucy Hanna, Declan Warren, Piper McLeod, Amy Phillips, Elan Cotter, Georgia Dickie, Isabella Godfrey, Lucinda McSherry, Millie Barnes, Nick Warren, Ella O’Donoghue, Isobel Hyett, Michael Guzzardi, Lucy Phillips, Clare Olding and Jagger Skilbeck.

Under the category ‘Primary Animation’, Years 5 and 6, Yarraville West Primary School, Victoria, were the Screen It 2012 winners.

results.title: Sunday
results.creator_credit: South Australian Film Corporation and Chris Backhouse
results.brief_description: A clay animated short film where two gentlemen transform their lounge room into a ballet stage. While one plays the harp, the other one dons a tutu and dances to Beethoven’s “Fur Elise”. This simple Australian short is delightful and mischievous.
results.creator_credit_for_label: South Australian Film Corporation and Chris Backhouse

results.title: Sunbury
results.creator_credit: Cambridge Film Production and John Dixon
results.brief_description: The Sunbury Music Festival, held each Australia Day between 1972 and 1975 holds fond memories for the 35,000 plus people who attended. This video shows highlights of the first festival in 1972 and captures the excitement of a festival which showcased Australian Rock music and provides a document of Australian society in the seventies.

results.title: Sun, wind and wood
results.creator_credit: ONF | NFB, Edward Le Lorrain, Margaret Pettigrew, Kathleen Shannon and Dorothy Todd Henaut
results.brief_description: There are people who are fighting the high cost of energy by devising ingenious ways to use sun, wind and wood. This film illustrates the nature of these experiments, one of which is the Ark, a bio-shelter that, using natural systems only, provides housing, heat, food and electricity for a family.
